channel.title: Projects on Abhishek Verma
channel.description: Recent content in Projects on Abhishek Verma

item.title: Blockchain & Consensus Protocols
item.description: Mentor: Dr. Arnab Bhattacharya, IITK Stretch: Aug’17 - Nov’17 Complete Project: Blockchain Technology Explored various aspects of blockchains. Major field of study was consensus protocols based on concepts like Proof of Work, Proof of Stake and Proof of Space. Also covered Algorand and did a case study of Bitcoin and ZCash.

item.title: C to MIPS Compiler
item.description: Mentor: Dr. Amey Karkare, IITK Stretch: Jan’17 - Apr’17 Complete Project: C to MIPS Compiler Developed a C compiler that compiles to MIPS, implemented using Python. Implemented all stages of compiler design - lexer, parser, intermediate code generator and code generator. Handled a variety of semantic and syntactic errors using translation schemes. Built support for recursion, struct as parameter and return value, short circuit evaluation and other optimizations.

item.title: Chat Application using Socket Programming
item.description: Mentor: Dr. Dheeraj Sanghi, IITK Stretch: Oct’17 - Nov’17 Complete Project: ChatApp using Socket Programming Created a chat application using socket programming in python. Implemented a concurrent server with slaves listening for any incoming connection. Application provides various facilities such as SignUp, Login, Logout, Block/Unblock, Private/Broadcast messages.

item.title: Chatbot Development
item.description: Mentor: Programming Club, IITK Stretch: May’15 - July’15 Complete Project: Chatbot Developed a chatbot, called IVANA which behaved like humans. Used the Natural Language Toolkit(NLTK) library of Python to implement NLP techniques. Designed and implemented three distinct algorithms using N-Grams, WordNet and Part-of-Speech tagging in english language. Database handling was done in MySQL. Also, a visual app was deployed for the same.

item.title: Combinatorial Game Theory
item.description: Mentor: Dr. Rajat Mittal, IITK Stretch: Sep’15 - Nov’15 Complete Project: Combinatorial Game Theory Studied the basic concepts of combinatorial game theory and the analysis of various games like Nim, Hex and Tic Tac Toe. Studied the mathematical treatment of games and some of the results that can be derived from it.

item.title: Development of Prutor - An interface to indroduce people to the world of programming
item.description: Mentor: Dr. Amey Karkare, IITK Stretch: Jan’17 - Apr’17 Complete Project: Prutor Interface Added admin side modules and features to Prutor, a Node.js platform used to teach programming to 800 first year students every year in IIT Kanpur. Worked on Node.js, SQL, HTML and CSS like technologies. Used docker to run all the services.

item.title: Learning Atari Game strategies using Deep Reinforcement Learning
item.description: Mentor: Dr. Piyush Rai, IITK Stretch: Oct’16 - Nov’16 Complete Project: Deep Reinforcement Learning Created an AI agent which learnt to play a number of Atari Games and defeated Atari hard-coded AIs, using same set of hyper parameters. Implemented Q Learning algorithm described in seminal papers by Google Deepmind and used a Convolutional Double Dueling Deep Neural Q-network to approximate the Q value function. Used Bellman Equation and followed deep policy network based approach to implement Monte Carlo policy gradients.

item.title: Multichain for Medical Records
item.description: Mentor: Dr. Satyadev Nandakumar, IITK & Dr. Piyush P. Kurur, IITK Stretch: Aug’17 - Nov’17 Complete Project: Blockchain based Smart Transaction Platform Studied about decentralised databases, database synchronisation, encryption techniques, proof of work, verification rules used by miners and importance of round robin scheduling for miners. Built the database of the platform using MultiChain library incorporating features to create blockchains, streams and perform transactions. Backend was JavaScript based and frontend was HTML5/CSS based.

item.title: NachOS
item.description: Mentor: Dr. Mainak Chaudhuri, IITK Stretch: Aug’16 - Nov’16 Complete Project: Extension of NachOS Implemented fork, join and exec system calls in NachOS-instructional C++ software to run as secondary OS. Compared algorithms for page replacement, process scheduling, demand paging, shared memory and syn-chronisation support.

item.title: Railway Enquiry System
item.description: Mentor: Dr. Medha Atre, IITK Stretch: Jan’17 - Apr’17 Complete Project: RailQuery Implemented queries like trains between stations involving optimized parameters such as minimum cost, time or distance using Neo4j. Implemented alogithms like Dijkstra’s Algorithm and BFS-Traversal.

item.title: Security of Zoobar Server
item.description: Mentor: Dr. Sandeep Shukla, IITK Stretch: Jan’18 - Apr’18 Complete Project: Security of Zoobar Server Found, exploited and fixed stack overflow, format string, DoS vulnerebilities and various other network layer attacks in the zoobar server. Crafted and demonstrated XSS, SQL injections and numerous browser based attacks on the server using scripts written in C++ and Python.

item.title: Stacked Attention Network for Visual Question Answering
item.description: Mentor: Dr. Vinay P. Namboodiri, IITK Stretch: Aug’17 - Nov’17 Complete Project: Stacked Attention Network Modified SANs for VQA using Visual Grounding of Phrases. SANs use semantic representation of a question as query to search for the regions in an image that are related to the answer. Implemented a multiple-layer SAN in which we query an image multiple times to infer the answer progressively.

item.title: Task oriented natural language end-to-end dialog system
item.description: Mentor: Dr. Harish Karnick, IITK Stretch: Jan’18 - Apr’18 Complete Project: Task Oriented Chatbot Teaching machines to converse naturally with humans to achieve specific tasks is very challenging. Currently, developing task oriented dialogue systems require specific hand-crafting. Also obtaining the dataset may be very cumbersome and costly. As a result, it is very difficult to scale them to new dimensions.The first implementation targets the first problem of specific hand-crafting. The second implementation improves it further by considerably reducing the data required.

item.title: Elanic Intern
item.description: NodeJS Development Nov’15 - Dec’15 Mentor: Pragyan Tripathi, CTO, Elanic Full Stack Development: Elasticsearch, MongoDB and NodeJS with Restify framework. Indexed all the data to Elasticsearch from MongoDB and builtREST APIs for search queries.

item.title: ShareChat Intern
item.description: Full Stack Development May’16 - July’16 Mentor: Bhanu Singh, CTO, ShareChat Worked on Mixpanel API to get data about the Mobile Application and used D3.js(Data Driven Documents), a data visualisation tool to convert raw data to presentable form. Data included retention and engagement cohorts. Was part of a 3 member team which whose responsibility was making, maintaining and deploying anandroid app which featured as Top Free in the Google Play Store.

item.title: Software Engineer at VISA
item.description: My Responsibilities at VISA July’18 - Present Manager: Mr. Dumesh Nair, Director of Software Engineering at VISA Responsibilities include designing, implementing and maintaining large scale distributed systems used in everyday payment transactions. Worked on detecting the future possibility of deadlock during parallel processing and dynamically changing the resource allocation algorithm. Designed and implemented Least Cost Routing(minimum possible fees paid by VISA) for debit and credit card transactions in a new sale service.

item.title: VISA Intern
item.description: My Projects at VISA Self-Heling Automation May’17 - July’17 Manager: Mr. Mohan Babu Nellore, Director-MAP Mentor: Mr. Arup Datta Implemented an intelligent automation architecture that makes sure all dependent components (VMs, services/applications, databases) are working as desired before running actual test suite to wipe off all false positives. This ensured that there is no downtimefor any service/API and also reduced development and test time by 90%. Implemented Restful APIs for application health-check, starting/stopping and re-starting the services using JAVA servlet framework.
